nodes.bodyText: @xieus - I didn't add the "message version/timestamp" at this point to handle out of order message. With multiple DPMs running for scale, out of order message could happen. Should we go ahead and add "uint32 message_version" for our "GoalState" message?
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -28,13 +28,14 @@ message PortConfiguration {

nodes.bodyText:
I would say that is the way to go. My recommendation is:

use the existing version, or rename it to "content_version" to track the content version of the message
use "format_version" or some better name to track the formatting version of the message (e.g. adding a new field)
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -28,13 +28,14 @@ message PortConfiguration {

nodes.bodyText: would the content_version be on the PortConfiguration level or on the GoalState level? I can see how we would do it at the GoalState level. Putting it on GoalState level would be complicated because we can have multiple PortConfiguration in one GoalState message.
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -28,13 +28,14 @@ message PortConfiguration {

nodes.bodyText: I think port level is appropriate.
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -28,13 +28,14 @@ message PortConfiguration {

nodes.bodyText:
ok, thinking about it on the route, I think we may need to use port ID and content_version as the "key" to determine the actual content_version since different port IDs on PortConfigurations won't conflict with each other right?
how do we deal with the below GoalState message which have?

PortConfiguration - portID = 1, content_version = 5
PortConfiguration - portID = 1, content_version = 7
PortConfiguration - portID = 1, content_version = 6

do we process the PortConfiguration in the order of 5, 6, 7? Note that we have parallel processing in ACA, so maybe we cannot go parallel when we detect there are multiple PortConfigurations with the same port ID within the same GoalState message?
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -28,13 +28,14 @@ message PortConfiguration {

nodes.bodyText:
This depends on whether the port configuration is full or delta. When comes to delta, out-of-order processing may or may not have impact to the results depending on scenarios. So it is important to identify those scenarios.
Regarding parallel processing, the answer is related to scenarios as well.
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -28,13 +28,14 @@ message PortConfiguration {

nodes.bodyText: ok, I will think about the scenarios a bit more.
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -28,13 +28,14 @@ message PortConfiguration {

nodes.bodyText: This new field would work for Kafka. How about RocketMQ or Pulsar? @haboy52581 @er1cthe0ne
this is the last blocking issue, I think we can merge this PR once we have answer on this.
mq_subscription_index has been removed per discussion.
Should we move id up a bit?
yes, ID is one of the most important field, I will move it up.
Do we need all of these fields for port given that we have better picture of OVS?

network_ns - was used during our previous k8s integration, we may need it for later k8s integration
mac_address - for virtual mac
veth_name - don't think we need that for OVS, I have moved that to mizar specific session
admin_state_up - neutron specific field, we want to keep it
Cool thanks!
Suggest to use "revision_number", which is used by controller APIs.
"revision_number"
Is network_ns used for Mizar only? If so, we could move it to the end.
we will likely use it for k8s integration based on our previous design, since all the containers endpoints are under some network namespace.
Got it.Thanks.
"revision_number"
"revision_number"
"revision_number"
